justification: The paper states that “FMT power is believed to originate in the ACC, and appears to reflect (at least in part) cognitive control processes requiring effort,” indicating that this EEG rhythm is used to gauge effortful control.
The authors note that “RewP amplitude may index individuals' subjective reward valuation signals,” so the ERP component is employed to measure how strongly rewards are valued.

They report that “the reward-related ERP comprising RewP is characterized in part by fluctuations in delta frequency band of 1–3 Hz,” and that delta power varies with reward sensitivity, making it a measure of reward processing.

measured_by: effort-discounting model parameters fitted to choice data
justification: The methods specify that behavioral choices will be fit with linear, hyperbolic, parabolic and sigmoidal discounting functions “to estimate the subjective value of each effort and reward combination,” linking the construct to these computational measures.

measured_by: Likert-scale item ‘How much do you want the reward offered?’
justification: Under Self-report questions, participants rate on a 1–7 scale how much they want the offered reward, directly operationalizing the construct of reward wanting.

measured_by: Likert-scale item ‘How much did you like the feedback you just received?’
justification: The same section has participants indicate on a 1–7 scale how much they liked the outcome feedback, making this item the measure of feedback liking.

measured_by: Likert-scale item ‘How motivated are you to exert the effort you just selected?’
justification: Participants also answer, on the identical scale, how motivated they are to perform the chosen effort, providing a direct self-report measure of motivation to exert effort.
